bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 16, [189-]

div1.p: Lazear describes life in California. He writes that he will visit his mother in Canada.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 16, [189-]
div1.p:
I have been
wanting to write you a
long letter ever since
I came out here but
something has always
prevented me.

We are up in the
mountains 150 miles
north of San Francisco.
It is frightfully hot
every day but gets cool
in the evening. No one
tries to do anything
during the heat of the day.
I live in a tent and
enjoy the life very much.
The food is very good
plenty of venison and
trout, and lettuce etc.
There is no rain during
the summer and the
garden is kept up by
irrigation. The last
32 miles of the trip here
was by a regular
mountain stage with four
horses over steep mountain
roads.

I enjoyed the stay in San Francisco very
much. Mabel took me around to
the interesting places to the shore
of the Pacific Ocean to the Government
reservation etc. including a dilightful
ride on the bay on a tug belonging
to the quarantine officers one of whom
is a cousin of the Houstons. This
same gentleman took me on an
exploring expedition with the board
of Health through the Chinese
quarter. San Francisco is always
cool but often foggy and windy.
The houses are nearly all wooden
and too much decorated outside but
there are always beautiful flower
gardens in front. The Houston's
house is charming, most tastefully
decorated furnished, and they live
very nicely, a very comfortable
table, well served.

I cannot say how
long we shall stay
here but probably for
a month.,

I think I shall return
by the Canadian Pacific
and in that case shall
stop for you at Hatley

I hope you are having
a pleasant time this
summer. I got a letter
from you in San Francisco
but none has come
since I have been
here. I fear that
the forwarding
arrangements were not
properly done at
San Francisco. It will
be arranged at once.
We get mail only
three times a week.

Mabel is looking
very well this summer.
I manage of course
to see a great deal
of her and consequently am
enjoying myself very much.
All this will make it all
the harder when I have to leave.
Unfortunately, I suppose everyone
has his troubles though.
